QueryText: CONTROL OF CODLING MOTH OF APPLE TREE
how to control codling moth in apple
KccAns: Chemical spraying of insecticides ie Cypermethrin Quinalphos  1 ml litre of water and Chloropyriphos  15 ml litre of water as per the rate of infestation is helpful to control the codling moth insect during peak period

QueryText: FARMER ASKED QUERY ON Codling moth CONTROL  IN WATER APPLE
KccAns: RECOMMENDED TO SPRAY FLUBENDIAMIDE  FAME 40 ML 200 LITRES OF WATER  ACRE     40     200

QueryText: Regarding the codling moth in apple
KccAns: Spray Chlorpyriphos2ml  Dimethoate 2ml in 1 liter of water  or Imidacloprid 1ml in 35 liter of waterField sanitationCollect and destroy the infested fruits and cocoonsBanding - corrugated cardboard bands should be applied to tree trunksUse sex pheromone trapMass trap males with codling moth lure trapsRelease egg parasitoids Trichogramma embryophagum at 2000tree

QueryText: regarding attack of Codling moth in quince
KccAns: the farmer was advised to go for spray Dimethoate  100 ml per 100 liter of water moreover a spray of HMO should also be applied at bud burst stage

QueryText: regarding sprays to be followed for codling moth in quince apple
KccAns: the farmer was advised to go for 4 to 5 sprays of Dimethoate with a gap  of at least 15 days
